thread.title: G端nter Blobel Solved a Mystery of Cell Biology: How Proteins Navigate the Body

author: James R. Hagerty
title: G端nter Blobel Solved a Mystery of Cell Biology: How Proteins Navigate the Body
text:
G端nter Blobel left his native Germany in 1962 to attend graduate school at the University of Wisconsin. He thought he would stay in the U.S. a year or two. He ended up remaining for the rest of his life, becoming a professor at Rockefeller University in New York and winning a Nobel Prize in 1999 for his contributions to cell biology.
When he began his research in the 1960s, it was known that cells were tiny factories making proteins and other molecules vital for life. The mystery was how those molecules found their way to... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
